intro: Taraxacum fornicatum, commonly known as the saddleleaf dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves with a wavy margin and a yellow flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed head. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant is known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions and is often found in disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in botany and ecology.
